page.title: 10WRINGTON-CONGRESBURY RAILWAY
page.content: ALTHOUGH THE TRACK HAS BEEN REMOVED THE REMAINS OF THE RAILWAY LINE WHICH RAN FROM LOWER LANGFORD TO CONGRESBURY VIA WRINGTON ARE VERY OBVIOUS. AT COX'S GREEN TO THE SOUTH OF WRINGTON IS A SMALL INDUSTRIAL ESTATE ON THE SITE OF THE RAILWAY. IN WRINGTON ITSELF THE STREET NAME "STATION ROAD", A SIGNAL AND A BUILDING WHICH WAS OBVIOUSLY ONCE PART OF THE STATION CAN BE SEEN. FROM WRINGTON THE SMALL EMBANKMENT NEEDED TO RAISE THE LINE ABOVE THE FLOOD LEVEL OF THE RIVER YEO RUNS DUE WEST OUT OF THE BLOCK.
